title: If your response to a verbally abused player is "get over it"
body:
If someone has been verbally abused during the game, and even worse, if you have seen it yourself and still your response to that person is "get over it", you are getting your ass reported too.
You don't know what the circumstances of that person are. You don't know how they are mentally or emotionally. You don't know what kind of things they had to go through in life. NO ONE should have to "get over" harassment just because YOU are not affected by it. And if you agree with online harassment and support it this way, you are part of the problem too and so you are reported just as the abuser.
Period.

replies.body: What's the other option? To take it to heart? To dwell on it? Report and move on. Now if my good friends or family have something to say that's unpleasant then yeah I take it seriously and listen to what they say, But if I get cut off and flipped off cause someone I don't know is having a bad day I don't sit around and wonder if my driving is okay all day and get depressed about it.

Wouldn't not "getting over it" be dwelling on it though. If you're not over it, you're under it. If they are over it then I don't see how someone saying "get over it" would be offensive anyways.

How about:
"it's not your fault man, they are just an asshole"
"mute them, they are dead wrong"
"you're doing fine"
etc.

You can't compare how you would react when you are by yourself vs. how someone reacts when in a team setting.
Your team consists of players who are supposed to work with you and cooperate.

Imagine a family holiday gathering, you all are at a relative's house. You get some water from the kitchen and spill some on the floor, and your bitch of an aunt starts calling you mentally retarded for spilling water, and that you're ruining the host's house, etc.
AND NO ONE FROM YOUR FAMILY SPEAKS UP TO TELL HER TO SHUT UP OR TELL YOU THAT IT'S OKAY. 
That's troubling. Sure, you CAN get over it, easily. But when you are with people who are _**supposed to**_ support each other, including you, and they don't, it really makes you wonder who's got your back or not. 

Your teammates should have your back, and vice versa.

When a professor tells you that you will amount to nothing and are lucky to pass.
